section.title: The Product GL Accounts help screen
section.para: The Product GL Account is used to specify the default account to be used for a specific Product' and 'Account Type' combination. This setup will translate to one side of the journal entry only.

NOTE: Duplicate functionality .... This setup for the Product GL Account can also be setup using the 'Accounts' sub menu for the Product in Catalog Manager. Need to confirm whether this default work like a hierarchy....eg Product GL Defaults will override General Account defaults.
It is used for tracking product transactions at a more detailed level. Examples could be as follows:

listitem.para: Tracking Accounts Receivable by Product in the General Ledger
Tracking Cost of Goods by product (or product variation) in the General Ledger
Tracking Commissions paid by Product in the General Ledger

section.title: How do I add a new Product / GL Account Type mapping?
section.para: By default there are no Product / GL Account Type mappings that are configured as part of the OFBiz demo data.

listitem.para: Select the 'Account Type' from the drop down list (NOTE: In other screens this field is call the 'GL Account Type Id'.....)
Select the ' GL Account' to map it to from the drop down list
Enter or look up the 'Product Id' to be used
The new mapping will be displayed in the list at the bottom of the screen

section.para: NOTE: This mapping can also be also be done via the 'Accounts' sub menu for the Product. Any mapping created here will be displayed under the Product 'Accounts' sub menu. Alternatively any mapping created in the Product 'Accounts' sub menu will also be displayed here.

section.title: How do I update a Product / GL Account Type mapping?
section.para: A Product / GL Account Type mapping can be updated by modifying the GL Account only. If the product needs to be updated then the mapping will need to be deleted and then re-entered using the new product.

listitem.para: Locate the entry that needs to be updated in the list of Product / GL Account Type mappings
Modify the 'GL Account 'by using the drop down list next to the 'GL Account' field
The updated mapping will be displayed

section.title: How do I delete a Product / GL Account Type mapping?

listitem.para: Locate the entry that needs to be deleted in the list of Product / GL Account Type mappings
2. Press the 'Remove' button next to the entry

section.para: NOTE: This can also be done via the 'Accounts' sub menu for the Product using the 'Delete Link' button.
